Honest Ice Creams

Honesty is the Best Policy, Even When it Comes to Ice Cream

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. All of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams comes from a local dairy and as for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to your scoop.   What doesn’t go into our ice creams is just as important as what does. We never use artificial colors or  flavors, high fructose corn syrup or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.   As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be!  We are also committed to using only compostable cups, spoons and napkins.  We churn every batch, roll each waffle cone made from our homemade recipe and pack each pint by hand in our shop to serve up the most honest ice creams we can.   We hope you will enjoy them!

Honest Ice Creams
The Story Behind The Best Ice Cream in Austin, Texas

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. Most importantly, all of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams come from a local dairy. As for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love.  

What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.
 
As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

Lick Honest Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Honest Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either.
In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Honest Ice Creams.

Lick Ice Creams Co-Founders
Meet Anthony and Chad, the Brains Behind the Local Austin Shop

Anthony Sobotik and Chad Palmatier opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because they wanted to provide what Lick enthusiasts have come to recognize as “honest ice creams.” The two each grew up in small, rural communities, and Chad spent much of his youth enjoying local Texas homemade ice cream. 

The pair met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed, and after many visits to Chad’s hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what Chad grew up with...small town ice cream shops serving up seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients. Fresh, unique and delicious! Chad had never eaten ice cream at a chain — and from 2005 on, Anthony vowed her never would again.  

Flash forward, and Anthony, who had moved to NYC hoping to write for a food magazine, was working as a caterer and event planner for a prestigious company. When Chad’s career took them away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan out to the Midwest, he and Anthony began to mull over the possibility of opening their own ice cream shop. The more flavors they tasted and the more recipes they concocted, the more the notion began to show promise.

All the while, Chad was falling in love with Austin, Texas more on each trip to visit Anthony’s friends and family. In time, the right moment came for them to sell their Midwestern home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick, bringing local, honest ice creams to town for all to enjoy.

As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love.  

What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.
 
As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Meet Anthony and Chad, the Brains Behind the Local Austin Shop

Anthony Sobotik and Chad Palmatier opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because they wanted to provide what Lick enthusiasts have come to recognize as “honest ice creams.” The two each grew up in small, rural communities, and Chad spent much of his youth enjoying local Texas homemade ice cream. 

The pair met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed, and after many visits to Chad’s hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what Chad grew up with...small town ice cream shops serving up seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients. Fresh, unique and delicious! Chad had never eaten ice cream at a chain — and from 2005 on, Anthony vowed her never would again.  

Flash forward, and Anthony, who had moved to NYC hoping to write for a food magazine, was working as a caterer and event planner for a prestigious company. When Chad’s career took them away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan out to the Midwest, he and Anthony began to mull over the possibility of opening their own ice cream shop. The more flavors they tasted and the more recipes they concocted, the more the notion began to show promise.

All the while, Chad was falling in love with Austin, Texas more on each trip to visit Anthony’s friends and family. In time, the right moment came for them to sell their Midwestern home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick, bringing local, honest ice creams to town for all to enjoy.

Our Dairy

We Start with the Best in Texas (actually the world)!

All of our ice creams are made with 100% milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces.   The herd consists of handpicked Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When necessary, they supplement with grain that is non-GMO, corn and soy free. The delicious milk and cream produced is always non-homogenized and low temperature pasteurized.  This essentially means any harmful bacteria is eliminated while all of the beneficial enzymes stay in tact. All of these components make for very healthy and very delicious milk and cream. This is the stuff our grandparents drank and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Lick Ice Creams’ Dairy 
Where Austin’s Best Ice Cream Gets its Start

All of our ice creams are made with milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces. 

The herd consists of Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When supplemental feed is used, it is free of any GMOs.  The delicious milk and cream produced is always low-temperature pasteurized and non-homogenized. All of these components make for the most delicious milk and cream we’ve ever tasted. This is milk and cream like our grandparents drank, and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.   Johnsons Backyard Garden Hausbar Farm Boggy Creek Farm Springdale Farm Lightsey Farms Pure Luck Farm & Dairy G & S Groves Great Bean Chocolate Sonlight Apple Orchard Salt & Time Austin Honey Company Pecan Street Rum Garrison Brothers Bourbon Texas Olive Ranch Princess & Moose's Sister Bakery Genius Gin Markley Family Farm

We are also able to work with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bakers and bee keepers, who help enhance our ice creams with unique flavor profiles. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

Lick Ice Creams’ Farmers

Learn About the Farmers that Provide our Local Ingredients

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that collaborate with Lick. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer. We are also able to work with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bakers and bee keepers, who help enhance our ice creams with unique flavor profiles. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

Lick Ice Cream's Founders

Meet Anthony and Chad, the Brains Behind the Local Austin Shop

Anthony Sobotik and Chad Palmatier opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because they wanted to provide what Lick enthusiasts have come to recognize as “honest ice creams.” The two each grew up in small, rural communities, and Chad spent much of his youth enjoying local Texas homemade ice cream. The pair met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed, and after many visits to Chad’s hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what Chad grew up with...small town ice cream shops serving up seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients. Fresh, unique and delicious! Chad had never eaten ice cream at a chain — and from 2005 on, Anthony vowed her never would again. Flash forward, and Anthony, who had moved to NYC hoping to write for a food magazine, was working as a caterer and event planner for a prestigious company. When Chad’s career took them away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan out to the Midwest, he and Anthony began to mull over the possibility of opening their own ice cream shop. The more flavors they tasted and the more recipes they concocted, the more the notion began to show promise. All the while, Chad was falling in love with Austin, Texas more on each trip to visit Anthony’s friends and family. In time, the right moment came for them to sell their Midwestern home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick, bringing local, honest ice creams to town for all to enjoy.

Honest Ice Creams

The Story Behind The Best Ice Cream in Austin, Texas

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. Most importantly, all of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams come from a local dairy. As for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love. What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about. As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to your scoop.   What doesn’t go into our ice creams is just as important as what does. We never use artificial colors or  flavors, high fructose corn syrup or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.   As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be!  We are also committed to using only compostable cups, spoons and napkins.  We churn every batch, roll each waffle cone made from our homemade recipe and pack each pint by hand in our shop to serve up the most honest ice creams we can.   We hope you will enjoy them!

The pair met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). Honeyed Peaches with Rosemary

Deliciously sweet Texas peaches and local Round Rock Honey pair impeccably with fresh rosemary.

Where Austin's Best Ice Cream Gets its Start

All of our ice creams are made with milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces. The herd consists of Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When supplemental feed is used, it is free of any GMOs. The delicious milk and cream produced is always low-temperature pasteurized and non-homogenized. All of these components make for the most delicious milk and cream we’ve ever tasted. This is milk and cream like our grandparents drank, and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Get Honest Answers About Honest Ice Creams

Is your ice cream organic?

No. Although we use as many organic ingredients as possible, not everything we use is certified organic; and, therefore we cannot label Lick ice creams as “organic.” Since we cannot source everything organic, we make every effort to get our ingredients from sustainable farmers and responsible artisans; luckily, in Austin, Texas, they’re not too hard to find!

Are your products gluten-free?

Yes. Our ice creams are gluten-free. If there are ever any exceptions to this, we will certainly make it known to our customers. Our homemade ice cream cones are NOT gluten-free.

Are your waffle cones homemade?

Yes. We make our cone mix from scratch and roll each one by hand in our shops. Our cones contain local organic eggs and are NOT gluten-free.

Where do you make your ice cream?

We make every single batch by hand at our production kitchen in Northwest Austin.  Each flavor is created in 2½ gallon batches and either sent by the tub to our Austin and San Antonio shops or packed by hand into pint containers and distributed to our many wholesale customers all over the state of Texas.

Are all of your ingredients locally sourced?

Locavorism is very important to Lick Ice Creams, and we source locally every chance we get. Unfortunately, ingredients like vanilla, cocoa, coconut milk, and a handful of others do not yet grow in Texas. If ingredients are not available to be locally sourced, we make it a point to acquire them from small, locally-owned businesses wherever possible.

Honest Ice Creams

The Story Behind The Best Ice Cream in Austin, Texas

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. Most importantly, all of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams come from a local dairy. As for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love. What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about. As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

Lick Ice Cream's Founders

Meet Anthony and Chad, the Brains Behind the Local Austin Shop

Anthony Sobotik and Chad Palmatier opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because they wanted to provide what Lick enthusiasts have come to recognize as “honest ice creams.” The two each grew up in small, rural communities, and Chad spent much of his youth enjoying local Texas homemade ice cream. The pair met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed, and after many visits to Chad’s hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what Chad grew up with...small town ice cream shops serving up seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients. Fresh, unique and delicious! Chad had never eaten ice cream at a chain — and from 2005 on, Anthony vowed her never would again. Flash forward, and Anthony, who had moved to NYC hoping to write for a food magazine, was working as a caterer and event planner for a prestigious company. When Chad’s career took them away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan out to the Midwest, he and Anthony began to mull over the possibility of opening their own ice cream shop. The more flavors they tasted and the more recipes they concocted, the more the notion began to show promise. All the while, Chad was falling in love with Austin, Texas more on each trip to visit Anthony’s friends and family. In time, the right moment came for them to sell their Midwestern home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick, bringing local, honest ice creams to town for all to enjoy.

Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

Lick Honest Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Honest Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either. In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Honest Ice Creams.

Lick Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Anthony and Chad, the Brains Behind the Local Austin Shop

Anthony Sobotik and Chad Palmatier opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because they wanted to provide what Lick enthusiasts have come to recognize as “honest ice creams.” The two each grew up in small, rural communities, and Chad spent much of his youth enjoying local Texas homemade ice cream. The pair met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed, and after many visits to Chad’s hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what Chad grew up with...small town ice cream shops serving up seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients. Fresh, unique and delicious! Chad had never eaten ice cream at a chain — and from 2005 on, Anthony vowed her never would again. Flash forward, and Anthony, who had moved to NYC hoping to write for a food magazine, was working as a caterer and event planner for a prestigious company. When Chad’s career took them away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan out to the Midwest, he and Anthony began to mull over the possibility of opening their own ice cream shop. The more flavors they tasted and the more recipes they concocted, the more the notion began to show promise. All the while, Chad was falling in love with Austin, Texas more on each trip to visit Anthony’s friends and family. In time, the right moment came for them to sell their Midwestern home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick, bringing local, honest ice creams to town for all to enjoy.

Lick Ice Creams’ Dairy

Where Austin's Best Ice Cream Gets its Start

All of our ice creams are made with milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces. The herd consists of Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When supplemental feed is used, it is free of any GMOs. The delicious milk and cream produced is always low-temperature pasteurized and non-homogenized. All of these components make for the most delicious milk and cream we’ve ever tasted. This is milk and cream like our grandparents drank, and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Lick Ice Creams’ Farmers

Learn About the Farmers that Provide our Local Ingredients

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that collaborate with Lick. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer. We are also able to work with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bakers and bee keepers, who help enhance our ice creams with unique flavor profiles. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

Lick Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Anthony and Chad, the Brains Behind the Local Austin Shop

Anthony Sobotik and Chad Palmatier opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because they wanted to provide what Lick enthusiasts have come to recognize as “honest ice creams.” The two each grew up in small, rural communities, and Chad spent much of his youth enjoying local Texas homemade ice cream. The pair met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed, and after many visits to Chad’s hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what Chad grew up with...small town ice cream shops serving up seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients. Fresh, unique and delicious! Chad had never eaten ice cream at a chain — and from 2005 on, Anthony vowed her never would again. Flash forward, and Anthony, who had moved to NYC hoping to write for a food magazine, was working as a caterer and event planner for a prestigious company. When Chad’s career took them away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan out to the Midwest, he and Anthony began to mull over the possibility of opening their own ice cream shop. The more flavors they tasted and the more recipes they concocted, the more the notion began to show promise. All the while, Chad was falling in love with Austin, Texas more on each trip to visit Anthony’s friends and family. In time, the right moment came for them to sell their Midwestern home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick, bringing local, honest ice creams to town for all to enjoy.

Our Dairy

We Start with the Best in Texas (actually the world)!

All of our ice creams are made with 100% milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces.   The herd consists of handpicked Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When necessary, they supplement with grain that is non-GMO, corn and soy free. The delicious milk and cream produced is always non-homogenized and low temperature pasteurized.  This essentially means any harmful bacteria is eliminated while all of the beneficial enzymes stay in tact. All of these components make for very healthy and very delicious milk and cream. This is the stuff our grandparents drank and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. Frequently Asked Questions

Get Honest Answers About Honest Ice Creams

Is your ice cream organic?

No. Although we use as many organic ingredients as possible, not everything we use is certified organic; and, therefore we cannot label Lick ice creams as “Organic.” Since we cannot source everything organic, we make every effort to do so from sustainable farmers and responsible artisans; luckily, in Austin, Texas, they’re not too hard to find!

Are your products gluten-free?

Yes . Our ice creams are gluten-free. If there are ever any exceptions to this, we will certainly make it known to our customers. Our homemade ice cream cones are NOT gluten-free.

Are your waffle cones homemade?

Yes . We make our cone mix from scratch and roll each one by hand here in our South Austin shop. Our cones contain eggs and are NOT gluten-free.

Where do you make your ice cream?

We make every single batch here at our shop on South Lamar in Austin. Each flavor is created in 21/2 gallon batches and either sent to the dipping cabinet or packed by hand into a pint container.

Are all of your ingredients locally sourced?

Locavorism is very important to Lick Ice Creams, and we source locally every chance we get. Unfortunately, ingredients like vanilla, cocoa, coconut milk, and a handful of others do not yet grow in Texas. If ingredients are not available to be locally sourced, we make it a point to acquire them from small, locally-owned businesses wherever possible.

Honest Ice Creams

Honesty is the best policy, even when it comes to ice cream.

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. Most importantly, all of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams come from a local dairy. As for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love. What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about. As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

We opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities enjoying homemade ice cream, Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and Chad from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to Chad's hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what Chad grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients. Fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. Chad never ate ice cream at a chain and from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either. In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine, but we all know how that goes), worked as a caterer and event planner where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared and began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually Chad's career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, Chad was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by it's creative spirit and local flavors.  Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin and begin the building of Lick.

The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces. The herd consists of handpicked Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When necessary, they supplement with grain that is non-GMO, corn and soy free. The delicious milk and cream produced is always non-homogenized and low temperature pasteurized.  This essentially means any harmful bacteria is eliminated while all of the beneficial enzymes stay in tact. All of these components make for very healthy and very delicious milk and cream. This is the stuff our grandparents drank and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We couldn't and wouldn't do it without them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that we get to work with. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to give us and when it gives it to us. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food Artisans, such as Chocolatiers, Bee Keepers and even Butchers who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams . They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

Our Farmers & Artisans

From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

Frequently Asked Questions

Get Honest Answers About Honest Ice Creams

Is your ice cream organic? No. Although we use as many organic ingredients as possible, not everything we use is certified organic, and therefore we cannot label Lick ice creams as “Organic.” Since we cannot source everything organic, we make every effort to do so from sustainable farmers and responsible artisans; luckily, in Austin, Texas, they’re not too hard to find! Are your products gluten-free? Yes . Our ice creams are gluten-free. If there are ever any exceptions to this, we will certainly make it known to our customers. Our homemade ice cream cones are NOT gluten-free. Are your waffle cones homemade? Yes . We make our cone mix from scratch and roll each one by hand here in our South Austin shop. Our cones contain eggs and are NOT gluten-free. Where do you make your ice cream? We make every single batch here at our shop on South Lamar in Austin. Each flavor is created in 21/2 gallon batches and either sent to the dipping cabinet or packed by hand into a pint container. Are all of your ingredients locally sourced? Locavorism is very important to Lick Ice Creams, and we source locally every chance we get. Unfortunately, ingredients like vanilla, cocoa, coconut milk, and a handful of others do not yet grow in Texas. If ingredients are not available to be locally sourced, we make it a point to acquire them from small, locally-owned businesses wherever possible.

Honest Ice Creams

Honesty is the Best Policy, Even When it Comes to Ice Cream

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. Most importantly, all of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams come from a local dairy. As for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love. What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about. As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

Frequently Asked Questions

Get Honest Answers About Honest Ice Creams

Is your ice cream organic?

No. Although we use as many organic ingredients as possible, not everything we use is certified organic, and therefore we cannot label Lick ice creams as “Organic.” Since we cannot source everything organic, we make every effort to do so from sustainable farmers and responsible artisans; luckily, in Austin, Texas, they’re not too hard to find!

Are your products gluten-free?

Yes . Our ice creams are gluten-free. If there are ever any exceptions to this, we will certainly make it known to our customers. Our homemade ice cream cones are NOT gluten-free.

Are your waffle cones homemade?

Yes . We make our cone mix from scratch and roll each one by hand here in our South Austin shop. Our cones contain eggs and are NOT gluten-free.

Where do you make your ice cream?

We make every single batch here at our shop on South Lamar in Austin. Each flavor is created in 21/2 gallon batches and either sent to the dipping cabinet or packed by hand into a pint container.

Are all of your ingredients locally sourced?

Locavorism is very important to Lick Ice Creams, and we source locally every chance we get. Unfortunately, ingredients like vanilla, cocoa, coconut milk, and a handful of others do not yet grow in Texas. If ingredients are not available to be locally sourced, we make it a point to acquire them from small, locally-owned businesses wherever possible.

Lick Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either. In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Ice Creams.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

Our Dairy

We Start with the Best in Texas!

All of our ice creams are made with milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces. The herd consists of handpicked Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When necessary, they supplement with grain that is non-GMO, corn and soy free. The delicious milk and cream produced is always non-homogenized and low temperature pasteurized.  This essentially means any harmful bacteria is eliminated while all of the beneficial enzymes stay in tact. All of these components make for very healthy and very delicious milk and cream. This is the stuff our grandparents drank and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Honest Ice Creams

Honesty is the Best Policy, Even When it Comes to Ice Cream

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. Most importantly, all of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams come from a local dairy. As for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love.   What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.   As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love.   What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.   As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

Our Dairy

We Start with the Best in Texas!

All of our ice creams are made with milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces.   The herd consists of handpicked Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When necessary, they supplement with grain that is non-GMO, corn and soy free. The delicious milk and cream produced is always non-homogenized and low temperature pasteurized.  This essentially means any harmful bacteria is eliminated while all of the beneficial enzymes stay in tact. All of these components make for very healthy and very delicious milk and cream. This is the stuff our grandparents drank and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Grapefruit with Champagne Marshmallows

Our friends at Princess & Moose's Sister Bakery have created for us, handmade champagne marshmallows (corn syrup free, of course) that  we  float through a refreshing and tart grapefruit ice cream.  Grapefruits are from the good ole' Rio Grande Valley!

Grapefruit Ginger

The tartness of Texas Rio Star grapefruit gets an added kick from the zing of fresh ginger.

post_content:
Lick Honest Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Honest Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either.
In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Ice Creams.

Honest Ice Creams

Honesty is the Best Policy, Even When it Comes to Ice Cream

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. All of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams comes from a local dairy and as for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to your scoop.   What doesn’t go into our ice creams is just as important as what does. We never use artificial colors or  flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.   As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be!  We are also committed to using only compostable cups, spoons and napkins.  We churn every batch, roll each waffle cone made from our homemade recipe and pack each pint by hand in our shop to serve up the most honest ice creams we can.   We hope you will enjoy them!

Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Ice Creams.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient.   We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

We hope you enjoy our new site & that it serves you well! We intend to keep our flavors updated & any useful information handy. Be sure to follow us on Facebook & Twitter & sign up for the newsletter. Enjoy & please contact us if you have any suggestions. Thanks for visiting!

Honeyed Peaches with Rosemary

Deliciously sweet Texas peaches and local Round Rock Honey pair impeccably with fresh rosemary.

Lemon Berry

Our newest dairy-free option is bright and refreshing! Sweet strawberries from New Braunfels, Texas are blended with the juice of organic Meyer Lemons  from G&S Groves in the Rio Grande Valley.  To finish if off, we add a touch of vanilla and some Round Rock Honey.

Pecan Rum Pie

Sweet and chewy pecan pie filling is accented with smoky and rich Pecan Street Rum!

Hours of Ice Cream Scooping

Get it While it’s Cold (and in Season)!

Here at Lick, we're scooping our honest ice creams every day. Stop by for a visit with friends or family and give your tastebuds a local treat! Don't be afraid to sample as many as you'd like. Come on by:

Lick Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either. In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Ice Creams.

Honest Ice Creams

Honesty is the Best Policy, Even When it Comes to Ice Cream

To us, honest ice creams simply means we use only pure, whole ingredients. Most importantly, all of the milk and cream used to make our ice creams come from a local dairy. As for everything else, we know where every ingredient originates. We know each of the farmers and food artisans we source from. We adore our local farmers, visiting them frequently to personally pick up fresh ingredients weekly from their farms or market stands. Watching the cows graze at their leisure in the beautiful Central Texas pastures never fails to bring smiles to our faces. As small local business owners, we have the pleasure of witnessing our milk and cream as it journeys from the cow to our scoop, and finally, to your taste buds. We make every batch and pack each pint by hand in our shop to deliver the premium ice cream our customers love.   What doesn’t go into our ice creams is nearly as important as what does. We never use artificial flavors, high fructose corn syrup, stabilizers or preservatives...ever! Ice cream shouldn’t just taste good — we believe it should also be good. Unique ice cream flavors that come from only the finest ingredients (and nothing else) is what we’re all about.   As a sustainable business, Lick takes a cue from the ever-wise Mother Nature. Many of our flavors are inspired by and created with the seasonal offerings from the fertile land in and around Austin, Texas. This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Here at Lick, we’re proud to offer our friends and neighbors the very best ice cream Austin has to offer.

Our Dairy

We Start with the Best in Texas!

All of our ice creams are made with milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces. The herd consists of handpicked Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When necessary, they supplement with grain that is non-GMO, corn and soy free. The delicious milk and cream produced is always non-homogenized and low temperature pasteurized.  This essentially means any harmful bacteria is eliminated while all of the beneficial enzymes stay in tact. All of these components make for very healthy and very delicious milk and cream. This is the stuff our grandparents drank and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

Sweet Potato

Hints of ground nutmeg, molasses and local Round Rock Honey bring out the best in the deliciously ambrosial roasted sweet potatoes.

Spiked Eggnog

A holiday favorite! Homemade eggnog prepared with Vital Farms pasture raised, organic eggs and a shot of Brandy.

Peppermint Bark

Inspired by the season, fresh peppermint and sweet cream are accented with a swirl of Great Bean dark chocolate ganache.

Coconut & Avocado Curd

Silky smooth and rich homemade avocado curd is swirled through a delicious coconut milk base.

Spicy Coconut & Peanut

Start with coconut milk, add organic peanut butter and top it off with a hint of cayenne pepper.

Coconut & Avocado Curd (vegan)

Silky smooth and rich homemade avocado curd is swirled through a delicious coconut milk base.

Coconut, Peanut Butter & Chocolate Swirl

Coconut milk and peanut butter are finished with a swirling layer of local Delysia dark chocolate.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient.   We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.

This provides variety throughout the year and guarantees a product that is always as fresh as can be! Pecans baked with brown sugar, cardamom and thyme are blended with Garrison Brothers Texas Bourbon Whiskey.

Spiked Eggnog

A holiday favorite! Homemade eggnog prepared with Vital Farms pasture raised, organic eggs and a shot of Pecan Street Rum.

Peppermint Bark

Inspired by the season, fresh peppermint and sweet cream are accented with a swirl of local Delysia dark chocolate ganache.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.   Johnsons Backyard Garden Hausbar Farm Boggy Creek Farm Springdale Farm Lightsey Farms Pure Luck Farm & Dairy G & S Groves Delysia Chocolatier Salt & Time Round Rock Honey Pecan Street Rum Garrison Brothers Bourbon

Come by for a taste of our new Valentine's Day collection as well as a couple of new everyday offerings!

Our Dairy

We Start with the Best in Texas!

All of our ice creams are made with milk and cream from Mill-King Market & Creamery, located in McGregor, Texas, just outside of Waco. The Miller family has owned and operated this dairy for three generations. They are some of the hardest working people you will ever meet, and they truly care about the milk and cream their select herd of 100 cows produces. The herd consists of handpicked Jersey, Brown Swiss and Holstein cows that are never given hormones or antibiotics and are primarily grass-fed. When necessary, they supplement with grain that is non-GMO, corn and soy free. The delicious milk and cream produced is always non-homogenized and low temperature pasteurized.  This essentially means any harmful bacteria is eliminated while all of the beneficial enzymes stay in tact. All of these components make for very healthy and very delicious milk and cream. This is the stuff our grandparents drank and it’s the reason we can make ice creams as honest as the ones they enjoyed.

post_title: Meet the Lick Ice Cream founders!

post_content:
Lick Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either.   In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Ice Creams.

Frequently Asked Questions

Get Honest Answers About Honest Ice Creams

Is your ice cream organic?

No. Although we use as many organic ingredients as possible, not everything we use is certified organic; and, therefore we cannot label Lick ice creams as “organic.” Since we cannot source everything organic, we make every effort to get our ingredients from sustainable farmers and responsible artisans; luckily, in Austin, Texas, they’re not too hard to find!

Are your products gluten-free?

Yes. Our ice creams are gluten-free. If there are ever any exceptions to this, we will certainly make it known to our customers. Our homemade ice cream cones are NOT gluten-free.

Are your waffle cones homemade?

Yes. We make our cone mix from scratch and roll each one by hand here in our South Austin shop. Our cones contain eggs and are NOT gluten-free.

Where do you make your ice cream?

We make every single batch here at our shop on South Lamar in Austin. Each flavor is created in 2½ gallon batches and either sent to the dipping cabinet or packed by hand into a pint container.

Are all of your ingredients locally sourced?

Locavorism is very important to Lick Ice Creams, and we source locally every chance we get. Unfortunately, ingredients like vanilla, cocoa, coconut milk, and a handful of others do not yet grow in Texas. If ingredients are not available to be locally sourced, we make it a point to acquire them from small, locally-owned businesses wherever possible.

Lick Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either. In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Ice Creams.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.   Johnsons Backyard Garden Hausbar Farm Boggy Creek Farm Springdale Farm Lightsey Farms Pure Luck Farm & Dairy G & S Groves   Delysia Chocolatier Salt & Time Round Rock Honey Pecan Street Rum Garrison Brothers Bourbon Texas Olive Ranch Princess & Moose's Sister Bakery

Frequently Asked Questions

Get Honest Answers About Honest Ice Creams

Is your ice cream organic?

No. Although we use as many organic ingredients as possible, not everything we use is certified organic; and, therefore we cannot label Lick ice creams as “organic.” Since we cannot source everything organic, we make every effort to get our ingredients from sustainable farmers and responsible artisans; luckily, in Austin, Texas, they’re not too hard to find!

Are your products gluten-free?

Yes. Our ice creams are gluten-free. If there are ever any exceptions to this, we will certainly make it known to our customers. Our homemade ice cream cones are NOT gluten-free.

Are your waffle cones homemade?

Yes. We make our cone mix from scratch and roll each one by hand here in our South Austin shop. Our cones contain eggs and are NOT gluten-free.

Where do you make your ice cream?

We make every single batch here at our shop on South Lamar in Austin. Each flavor is created in 2½ gallon batches and either sent to the dipping cabinet or packed by hand into a pint container.

Are all of your ingredients locally sourced?

Locavorism is very important to Lick Ice Creams, and we source locally every chance we get. Unfortunately, ingredients like vanilla, cocoa, coconut milk, and a handful of others do not yet grow in Texas. If ingredients are not available to be locally sourced, we make it a point to acquire them from small, locally-owned businesses wherever possible.

There really is a Hazel and she’s my granny.  Each year for Thanksgiving she would make at least one pumpkin pie and she’d say it was just for me, usually by whispering it in my ear.  Maybe she didn’t want the other grandchildren to hear.  Whatever the reason, I LOVE her pumpkin pie.  I remember seeing them lined up with the other desserts on my grandparents’ bar and going out of my mind counting the minutes until it was time to dive in.  I’m a huge baked goods fanatic and even among all the other offerings my family members had crafted, my main objective was to get a piece of her pumpkin pie on my plate before it had been devoured by my cousins. So what made Hazel’s pumpkin pie leave such an impression on me, even after all these years?  Sure, you could assume that it was just the fact that my Granny, one of the women who taught me to bake and a person I love with all my heart, made the cake and I would of course love it out of my sheer emotional connection to the baker.   That is not the case.  Her pies really focused on the pumpkin.  So many times a pumpkin pie is loaded up with spices that the subtle, fresh flavor of the pumpkin is lost and it ends up tasting like a cinnamon pie with a dash of clove, nutmeg and ginger.  Granny’s pies were simple and delicious.  There was a nice balance of nutmeg, ginger and cinnamon.  She went a bit heavier on the clove, which I love.  I also remember eating her pumpkin pie and not feeling the need to cover it in whipped cream, although I have to admit (and I say this knowing I may be a bit judged) that there were times that I added a hefty dollop of cool-whip.   Today, we pay homage to this lovely, feisty, Texas lady with the flavor Hazel’s Pumpkin Pie.  We buy Texas pie pumpkins and roast them in the oven in our very own kitchen.  Once the seeds and flesh have been removed, pounds of it are blended into our ice cream base and enhanced with a little nutmeg, ginger and cinnamon.  We go a bit heavy on the clove.  What we get is the best pumpkin ice cream I’ve ever had that tastes like the most delicious, freshest pumpkin pie I’ve ever eaten.  Actually, if you’ve never had the pleasure of eating my Granny’s pumpkin pie, it’s probably better.

So what made Hazel’s pumpkin pie leave such an impression on me, even after all these years?  Sure, you could assume that it was just the fact that my Granny, one of the women who taught me to bake and a person I love with all my heart, made the cake and I would of course love it out of my sheer emotional connection to the baker.   That is not the case.  Her pies really focused on the pumpkin.  So many times a pumpkin pie is loaded up with spices that the subtle, fresh flavor of the pumpkin is lost and it ends up tasting like a cinnamon pie with a dash of clove, nutmeg and ginger.  Granny’s pies were simple and delicious.  There was a nice balance of nutmeg, ginger and cinnamon.  She went a bit heavier on the clove, which I love.  I also remember eating her pumpkin pie and not feeling the need to cover it in whipped cream, although I have to admit (and I say this knowing I may be a bit judged) that there were times that I added a hefty dollop of cool-whip.   Today, we pay homage to this lovely, feisty, Texas lady with the flavor Hazel’s Pumpkin Pie.  We buy Texas pie pumpkins and roast them in the oven in our very own kitchen.  Once the seeds and flesh have been removed, pounds of it are blended into our ice cream base and enhanced with a little nutmeg, ginger and cinnamon.  We go a bit heavy on the clove.  What we get is the best pumpkin ice cream I’ve ever had that tastes like the most delicious, freshest pumpkin pie I’ve ever eaten.  Actually, if you’ve never had the pleasure of eating my Granny’s pumpkin pie, it’s probably better.

Lick Honest Ice Creams' Co-Founders

Meet Us (Anthony and Chad). We Love Ice Cream!

We opened Lick Honest Ice Creams in the fall of 2011 because we wanted to offer what we call "honest ice creams" to savvy palates in Austin. We both grew up in small rural communities, enjoying homemade ice cream: Anthony from Hallettsville in South Central Texas and I from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. We met in New York City in the winter of 2005 and immediately connected (small town minds in the big city). As the years passed and after many visits to my hometown, Anthony began to truly appreciate what I grew up with...local, small town ice cream shops that made seasonal flavors with locally sourced ingredients: fresh, unique and delicious! With each lick, Anthony wondered what kind of flavors he could craft from the ingredients he grew up eating in Texas. I never ate ice cream at a chain, and, from 2005 on, Anthony didn't either. In New York, Anthony (who had actually moved to the city with hopes of being a writer for a food magazine) worked as a caterer and event planner, where he deepened his love of working with food. He became inspired by the menus he helped develop and the dishes once they were prepared, so he began mentally storing these for future use. Eventually, my career took us away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to the Midwest. As several years passed, ice cream was eaten, recipes were written, and the dream of honest ice creams began dancing in our heads. All the while, with each trip to visit Anthony's family and friends, I was falling more and more in love with Austin and becoming inspired by its creative spirit and local flavors. Finally, the right time came to sell our home, move to Austin, and begin building Lick Ice Creams.

Our Farmers & Artisans

We Couldn't and Wouldn't do it Without Them!

Austin is blessed with numerous farms and food artisans that work with Lick Ice Creams. From the fresh mint and earthy beets we get in East Austin, to the fragrant lavender and luscious peaches harvested in the Texas Hill Country out west, we base our flavors on what the land has to offer us and when the season is right for each ingredient. We are also able to collaborate with amazing local food artisans, such as chocolatiers, bee keepers — and even butchers — who help enhance the quality and flavor profiles of our ice creams. They ensure that you’ll never find a mass-produced, generic marshmallow or a non-local hint of honey in any of our ice creams.   Johnsons Backyard Garden Hausbar Farm Boggy Creek Farm Springdale Farm Lightsey Farms Pure Luck Farm & Dairy G & S Groves   Great Bean Chocolate Delysia Chocolatier Salt & Time Austin Honey Company Pecan Street Rum Garrison Brothers Bourbon Texas Olive Ranch Princess & Moose's Sister Bakery
